title: SwiftLint: Refactor OrgPreviewView.swift (cyclomatic_complexity, function_body_length, line_length)
description:
OrgPreviewView.swift has several warnings:

Break the large parsing function into smaller helpers and wrap long lines.

title: Navigate to search bar from top of list with up-arrow
description:
What: When the user is at the top of the note list and presses the up-arrow key, the focus should move to the search bar.

Why: To improve keyboard navigation efficiency, allowing users to quickly jump from browsing notes to searching without needing to use the mouse or multiple tab presses. This aligns with the 'Beep Audit' principle described in AGENTS.md.

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] Focus is on the note list.
- [ ] Selection is at the first item in the list.
- [ ] User presses the Up Arrow key.
- [ ] Focus moves to the search bar.
close_reason: Completed - up-arrow from first list item now moves focus to search bar

title: Cancel folder loading when selecting new folder
description:
What: Clicking the folder picker button should cancel any in-progress folder loading before starting to load the new folder.

Why: When loading very large folders (thousands of files), users may realize they selected the wrong folder. Currently they must wait for loading to complete. Allowing cancellation provides better UX.

Evaluate if this is possible. Create a design doc if it is a large project. 

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] Clicking folder button cancels current loadSavedFolder task
- [ ] Cancel is immediate (no waiting for current file enumeration)
- [ ] New folder selection proceeds normally after cancel
- [ ] No race conditions between cancel and new load
- [ ] Loading indicator updates appropriately during cancel
close_reason: Completed: Added cancellation support for folder loading via Task cancellation + CancellationFlag pattern

- Optional signing/notarization step gated behind secrets (no-op when secrets absent)

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] .github/workflows/ci.yml exists
- [ ] PR pushes trigger build verification
- [ ] Tag pushes trigger release creation
- [ ] GitHub Release has .dmg and .zip attached
- [ ] Works without signing secrets (unsigned build)

title: Perf: Skip non-text files early during directory enumeration
description:
During startup, discoverFiles() enumerates every file in the selected folder tree and checks extensions against allowedExtensions. While the extension filter exists (NoteStore.swift:369), the enumeration still visits every file in the directory tree — including images, binaries, .git contents, node_modules, etc.

Optimizations to investigate:
- Use NSDirectoryEnumerator's built-in predicate or UTType filtering to skip non-text files at the filesystem level before creating URL objects
- Skip well-known non-text directories early (.git, node_modules, .build, __pycache__, etc.) via enumerator skipDescendants
- Consider using `includingPropertiesForKeys: [.typeIdentifierKey]` and checking UTType.plainText conformance instead of a hardcoded extension list
- Measure impact on folders with many non-text files (e.g., a project repo with build artifacts)

Current code: NoteStore.swift:354 enumerateNotes()

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] Non-text files are skipped as early as possible in enumeration
- [ ] Known junk directories (.git, node_modules, etc.) are skipped via skipDescendants
- [ ] No regression for normal notes-only folders
- [ ] Measurable improvement on folders containing many non-text files
close_reason: Completed: Optimized file enumeration to skip non-text files and junk directories early using enumerator.skipDescendants(). Build passes with no regressions.

Why: The '#+TITLE: ' prefix is metadata syntax that clutters the preview. The actual title content is valuable and should remain visible.

Example:
- Before: #+TITLE: My Document Title
- After: My Document Title

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] Org mode files (.org extension) in preview strip the '#+TITLE: ' prefix from lines
- [ ] The title text after the prefix is still displayed
- [ ] Other org mode content displays normally
- [ ] Non-org files are unaffected
close_reason: Implemented: org metadata lines hidden from file list and preview

title: GitHub Releases Setup
description:
What: Configure GitHub Releases for distributing builds via CI.

Why: Standard distribution channel. Provides stable download URLs for Homebrew cask and direct downloads.

Requirements:
- GitHub Actions creates release on tag push (handled by CI workflow)
- Release has .dmg and .zip attached
- Release notes generated from commits since last tag
- Semantic versioning (v0.2.0 format)
- Stable download URL pattern for Homebrew cask

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] Pushing v*.*.* tag creates GitHub Release
- [ ] Release has DMG and ZIP artifacts
- [ ] Release notes are generated
- [ ] Download URLs follow predictable pattern
close_reason: Fixed ZIP artifact upload issue in build-release.sh. PR #62 created.

title: Markdown Preview Toggle
description: Optional preview pane showing rendered markdown. Toggle via Cmd-P or toolbar button. Preview replaces editor (not side-by-side). Keyboard scrollable. Type-to-exit: any letter/number key switches to editor mode instantly.
close_reason: Implemented Markdown preview toggle with Cmd-P, toolbar button, keyboard scrolling, and type-to-exit

title: DMG Creation
description:
What: Create drag-to-install DMG for distribution. Contains app and Applications folder alias.

Why: Standard macOS distribution format. Works without signing — users right-click > Open or use Homebrew (which strips quarantine).

Requirements:
- DMG created via hdiutil in build-release.sh
- Contains NeoNV.app and Applications symlink
- Optional custom background (can add later)
- Opens correctly, drag-to-install works
- Named NeoNV-{version}-macos-universal.dmg

Note: DMG is UNSIGNED (no paid Apple account). Gatekeeper warning expected for direct downloads. Homebrew cask strips quarantine automatically.

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] DMG opens with drag-to-Applications layout
- [ ] App launches after drag-to-install (with right-click > Open)
- [ ] Works without any Apple Developer account
close_reason: Completed: DMG creation implemented in scripts/build-release.sh with drag-to-Applications layout

title: Speech-to-Text Integration
description:
Support speech-to-text input via system dictation or Superwhisper integration. 

This is a nice-to-have - system dictation may work automatically with TextEditor. Verify and document.

Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] System dictation (Fn-Fn) works in editor
- [ ] Document any Superwhisper integration if applicable
close_reason: Out of scope
